intro: Muraltia saxifraga, commonly known as the rock rose or saxifrage, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rhamnaceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Muraltia saxifraga is often used in rock gardens due to its hardy nature and ornamental value.
